most_relevant_reviews.name: Ak
most_relevant_reviews.review: Great bun bo. Nothing is special or outstanding, but this is what you expect when you are looking for a good bowl of bun bo. The broth is clean and fairly rich, and the meat is tender and delicious. It was packed during the lunch hour on a weekday.

most_relevant_reviews.name: Mark
most_relevant_reviews.review: I've had so many B√∫n b√≤ in my life but this bowl was the most perfect one I've ever had! The taste of the meat and broth was amazing. Also the staff was lovely and very happy to see me. I couldn't recommend this place more!

most_relevant_reviews.name: Bao Ngan Ho
most_relevant_reviews.review: Very good and delicious "b√∫n b√≤". Staffs are nice and friendly. Price is also affordable.

most_relevant_reviews.name: Rob Quan
most_relevant_reviews.review:
Good food
Good price

most_relevant_reviews.name: Triet Nguyen
most_relevant_reviews.review: The restaurant makes delicious beef noodle soup. According to my taste, the water is clear, the price seems to be 35-50k per bowl depending on the toppings. The shop is a bit small, seating is a bit cramped. The shop owner told me again (because I ordered a mixed bag, but he said I had to order each item clearly like the menu), so I didn't really see it, minus 1 star.

most_relevant_reviews.name: Khanh Hu·ª≥nh
most_relevant_reviews.review:
Beef noodle soup is delicious, abundant, and cheap. However, the restaurant puts the ingredients and common dishwashing area near the dining table, so it doesn't look very aesthetically pleasing, and the dining table is clean.
The owner is friendly and pleasant. I've eaten there many times, but today I saw the owner pouring water from a plastic wrap into my bowl and I immediately asked to change the water. The owner thought I was criticizing the old water so he said it was new water for customers to buy. When I arrived, the customer didn't eat the onion so he left it behind. But because I don't like eating food in plastic bags/styrofoam boxes. The shop owner still happily exchanged it for me without any attitude.
In addition, this dish also includes bananas, because the shop owner bought it to support the banana seller. Add 1d plus for the shop

most_relevant_reviews.name: Richie Vo
most_relevant_reviews.review:
The shop is quite small, located in an alley but easy to find, with few parking spaces. When I arrived around lunch time, the shop was almost full.

The restaurant only has 1 chef and 1 waitress. The two siblings are enthusiastic and cute.

I ordered a bowl of fried pork sausage (as shown in the picture) for 35k and got free iced tea. Talking about the serving size, the topping is very good, 3 large soft pieces and the patty is firm. However, the broth is a bit light and not rich, the chili satay is not spicy, I added 2 large spoons but still didn't see anything, this is a huge minus point for the beef noodle dish, I hope the restaurant improves on this part. .

most_relevant_reviews.name: Ha Dinh
most_relevant_reviews.review:
Update menu August 2024.
The main restaurant is to eat on weekends.
The beef noodle shop is small and a bit hidden. To get to the restaurant by motorbike or car is a bit difficult because the road is very small. The most delicious here are the cartilage and tendons. Reasonable price from 35k, free iced tea, medium and slightly sweet broth. However, people often forget dishes. When eating, remember to repeat them many times or the restaurant will get the wrong dish.

most_relevant_reviews.review: The beef noodle soup here is popular, cheap but very delicious, suitable for me, the space is quite small but neat, free iced tea, spicy satay is very delicious

most_relevant_reviews.name: Toan Nguy·ªÖn
most_relevant_reviews.review:
+ The shop is on a small street, easy to find, park in front or on the side, it's sunny at noon, but it's cool to sit inside. The tables and chairs are simple, popular, and old, but the food looks clean.
+ The quality beef noodle soup is very delicious, especially the rib cartilage dish, which is super rolled and has a large portion. The broth is a bit fatty.
+ The staff is only 2 people but the service is fast, considerate, and cute.
+ Cheap price. Full range of payment methods.

most_relevant_reviews.review: I've had so many B√∫n b√≤ in my life but this bowl was the most perfect one I've ever had! The taste of the meat and broth was amazing. Also the staff was lovely and very happy to see me. I couldn't recommend this place more!

most_relevant_reviews.name: Bao Ngan Ho

most_relevant_reviews.name: Triet Nguyen
most_relevant_reviews.review: The restaurant makes delicious beef noodle soup. According to my taste, the water is clear, the price seems to be 35-50k per bowl depending on the toppings. The shop is a bit small, seating is a bit cramped. The shop owner told me again (because I ordered a mixed bag, but he said I had to order each item clearly like the menu), so I didn't really see it, minus 1 star.

most_relevant_reviews.name: Khanh Hu·ª≥nh
most_relevant_reviews.review:
Beef noodle soup is delicious, abundant, and cheap. However, the restaurant puts the ingredients and common dishwashing area near the dining table, so it doesn't look very aesthetically pleasing, and the dining table is clean.
The owner is friendly and pleasant. I've eaten there many times, but today I saw the owner pouring water from a plastic wrap into my bowl and I immediately asked to change the water. The owner thought I was criticizing the old water so he said it was new water for customers to buy. When I arrived, the customer didn't eat the onion so he left it behind. But because I don't like eating food in plastic bags/styrofoam boxes. The shop owner still happily exchanged it for me without any attitude.
In addition, this dish also includes bananas, because the shop owner bought it to support the banana seller. Add 1d plus for the shop

most_relevant_reviews.name: Richie Vo
most_relevant_reviews.review:
The shop is quite small, located in an alley but easy to find, with few parking spaces. When I arrived around lunch time, the shop was almost full.

The restaurant only has 1 chef and 1 waitress. The two siblings are enthusiastic and cute.

I ordered a bowl of fried pork sausage (as shown in the picture) for 35k and got free iced tea. Talking about the serving size, the topping is very good, 3 large soft pieces and the patty is firm. However, the broth is a bit light and not rich, the chili satay is not spicy, I added 2 large spoons but still didn't see anything, this is a huge minus point for the beef noodle dish, I hope the restaurant improves on this part. .

most_relevant_reviews.name: Ha Dinh
most_relevant_reviews.review:
Update menu August 2024.
The main restaurant is to eat on weekends.
The beef noodle shop is small and a bit hidden. To get to the restaurant by motorbike or car is a bit difficult because the road is very small. The most delicious here are the cartilage and tendons. Reasonable price from 35k, free iced tea, medium and slightly sweet broth. However, people often forget dishes. When eating, remember to repeat them many times or the restaurant will get the wrong dish.

most_relevant_reviews.name: Toan Nguy·ªÖn
most_relevant_reviews.review:
+ The shop is on a small street, easy to find, park in front or on the side, it's sunny at noon, but it's cool to sit inside. The tables and chairs are simple, popular, and old, but the food looks clean.
+ The quality beef noodle soup is very delicious, especially the rib cartilage dish, which is super rolled and has a large portion. The broth is a bit fatty.
+ The staff is only 2 people but the service is fast, considerate, and cute.
+ Cheap price. Full range of payment methods.

most_relevant_reviews.name: Mai Nguy·ªÖn
most_relevant_reviews.review: It's been a long time since I've found a restaurant with similar flavors to the old restaurant I ate at, sold by Hue people. The bowl I ate was rare, and the spring rolls and tendons cost 50k (in my opinion, it's cheap compared to other places). Each person's iced tea comes in a large glass with a straw, but it's free. The shop is small, customers come and go continuously. Cute owner. And this restaurant will be the one I stop at for my favorite beef noodle soup after the old restaurant has decided to sell. Writing a review makes me crave it again üòÖ

most_relevant_reviews.name: Sandy Ph·∫°m
most_relevant_reviews.review: The restaurant is quite small but the beef noodle soup is very delicious, with many choices. The owner and her son are very friendly with guests.

most_relevant_reviews.name: isntle
most_relevant_reviews.review:
Completely agree with everyone's previous reviews. But it seems the shop has had enough customers so now the owner has changed her tone.
In the past, no matter how elegant and polite, if I were to sell my time, I would probably lose it all along with a few bowls of beef noodle soup. Extremely bad attitude, in recent months I have visited 5 times, 2 times I saw the owner having an attitude towards other tables, 2 times she had an attitude towards my own table & the peak was today. At first I thought she was joking, then I saw she was rude, and later I saw she was intentionally trying to show people how polite she was. I've given the restaurant too many chances, but every time I come and leave, I feel frustrated, eating a bowl of vermicelli and paying for it makes me feel angry. The three recent reviews are probably all self-posted and self-voted. I don't understand how anyone could praise the landlady for being civilized.

most_relevant_reviews.review:
Beef noodle soup is okay to eat.

And after eating, I had a stomach ache even though I ordered the vegetables to be boiled and the restaurant seemed quite clean?!

most_relevant_reviews.review:
The owner here is super cute, very friendly and civilized. I sat and ate and listened to her talk to everyone from the seller to the neighbor, the buyer was very gentle and polite.
A bowl of beef noodle soup here costs 35k, she sells a lot of meat, that day she gave me a lump of meat as big as braised beef but super soft and delicious. The only thing was that I ate at late afternoon so the water was a bit sharp and I ate it a little salty but it also depends on my taste. Overall it's so delicious.
I see you sell cashew nuts and cashew candy too. A box of cashew candy for 95k is also very delicious. If you have a chance, come here and try it because you're so cute :)))

The restaurant only has 1 chef and 1 waitress. The two siblings are enthusiastic and cute.

I ordered a bowl of fried pork sausage (as shown in the picture) for 35k and got free iced tea. Talking about the serving size, the topping is very good, 3 large soft pieces and the patty is firm. However, the broth is a bit light and not rich, the chili satay is not spicy, I added 2 large spoons but still didn't see anything, this is a huge minus point for the beef noodle dish, I hope the restaurant improves on this part. .

highest_rating_reviews.review:
Beef noodle soup is delicious, abundant, and cheap. However, the restaurant puts the ingredients and common dishwashing area near the dining table, so it doesn't look very aesthetically pleasing, and the dining table is clean.
The owner is friendly and pleasant. I've eaten there many times, but today I saw the owner pouring water from a plastic wrap into my bowl and I immediately asked to change the water. The owner thought I was criticizing the old water so he said it was new water for customers to buy. When I arrived, the customer didn't eat the onion so he left it behind. But because I don't like eating food in plastic bags/styrofoam boxes. The shop owner still happily exchanged it for me without any attitude.
In addition, this dish also includes bananas, because the shop owner bought it to support the banana seller. Add 1d plus for the shop

highest_rating_reviews.review: It's been a long time since I've found a restaurant with similar flavors to the old restaurant I ate at, sold by Hue people. The bowl I ate was rare, and the spring rolls and tendons cost 50k (in my opinion, it's cheap compared to other places). Each person's iced tea comes in a large glass with a straw, but it's free. The shop is small, customers come and go continuously. Cute owner. And this restaurant will be the one I stop at for my favorite beef noodle soup after the old restaurant has decided to sell. Writing a review makes me crave it again üòÖ

lowest_rating_reviews.name: isntle
lowest_rating_reviews.review:
Completely agree with everyone's previous reviews. But it seems the shop has had enough customers so now the owner has changed her tone.
In the past, no matter how elegant and polite, if I were to sell my time, I would probably lose it all along with a few bowls of beef noodle soup. Extremely bad attitude, in recent months I have visited 5 times, 2 times I saw the owner having an attitude towards other tables, 2 times she had an attitude towards my own table & the peak was today. At first I thought she was joking, then I saw she was rude, and later I saw she was intentionally trying to show people how polite she was. I've given the restaurant too many chances, but every time I come and leave, I feel frustrated, eating a bowl of vermicelli and paying for it makes me feel angry. The three recent reviews are probably all self-posted and self-voted. I don't understand how anyone could praise the landlady for being civilized.

lowest_rating_reviews.name: Hung Vu
lowest_rating_reviews.review:
Beef noodle soup is okay to eat.
Taste okay.
The stewed pork trotters were tender but bland, and the beef was a bit dry.
And after eating, I had a stomach ache even though I ordered the vegetables to be boiled and the restaurant seemed quite clean?!

lowest_rating_reviews.name: Richie Vo
lowest_rating_reviews.review:
The shop is quite small, located in an alley but easy to find, with few parking spaces. When I arrived around lunch time, the shop was almost full.

The restaurant only has 1 chef and 1 waitress. The two siblings are enthusiastic and cute.

I ordered a bowl of fried pork sausage (as shown in the picture) for 35k and got free iced tea. Talking about the serving size, the topping is very good, 3 large soft pieces and the patty is firm. However, the broth is a bit light and not rich, the chili satay is not spicy, I added 2 large spoons but still didn't see anything, this is a huge minus point for the beef noodle dish, I hope the restaurant improves on this part. .

lowest_rating_reviews.name: isntle
lowest_rating_reviews.review:
Completely agree with everyone's previous reviews. But it seems the shop has had enough customers so now the owner has changed her tone.
In the past, no matter how elegant and polite, if I were to sell my time, I would probably lose it all along with a few bowls of beef noodle soup. Extremely bad attitude, in recent months I have visited 5 times, 2 times I saw the owner having an attitude towards other tables, 2 times she had an attitude towards my own table & the peak was today. At first I thought she was joking, then I saw she was rude, and later I saw she was intentionally trying to show people how polite she was. I've given the restaurant too many chances, but every time I come and leave, I feel frustrated, eating a bowl of vermicelli and paying for it makes me feel angry. The three recent reviews are probably all self-posted and self-voted. I don't understand how anyone could praise the landlady for being civilized.

lowest_rating_reviews.name: Richie Vo
lowest_rating_reviews.review:
The shop is quite small, located in an alley but easy to find, with few parking spaces. When I arrived around lunch time, the shop was almost full.

The restaurant only has 1 chef and 1 waitress. The two siblings are enthusiastic and cute.

I ordered a bowl of fried pork sausage (as shown in the picture) for 35k and got free iced tea. Talking about the serving size, the topping is very good, 3 large soft pieces and the patty is firm. However, the broth is a bit light and not rich, the chili satay is not spicy, I added 2 large spoons but still didn't see anything, this is a huge minus point for the beef noodle dish, I hope the restaurant improves on this part. .

lowest_rating_reviews.name: Khanh Hu·ª≥nh
lowest_rating_reviews.review:
Beef noodle soup is delicious, abundant, and cheap. However, the restaurant puts the ingredients and common dishwashing area near the dining table, so it doesn't look very aesthetically pleasing, and the dining table is clean.
The owner is friendly and pleasant. I've eaten there many times, but today I saw the owner pouring water from a plastic wrap into my bowl and I immediately asked to change the water. The owner thought I was criticizing the old water so he said it was new water for customers to buy. When I arrived, the customer didn't eat the onion so he left it behind. But because I don't like eating food in plastic bags/styrofoam boxes. The shop owner still happily exchanged it for me without any attitude.
In addition, this dish also includes bananas, because the shop owner bought it to support the banana seller. Add 1d plus for the shop
